body.p: May I, sir, who have not the pleasure of a personal acquaintance with you, ask of your Excellency the appointment of my friend Frederick Webber Esqr. as a Notary Public of this County. --

I am aware, Sir, that the appointments for this County are numerous, but Mr Webber occupies a position in a public Office in this city where such an office may from a convenience to the public and of some little pecuniary advantage to himself, who I feel every confidence in recommending to you Excellency as a most worth and Excellent gentleman. --
Having held the Office of Notary in this county for the last twelve or fifteen years I cannot be thought selfish in making this recommendation --
I can refer your Excellency to any of the delegation from this County, or any of the Lawyers at this bar as to my own standing, and Mr. Webbers references might be a host if required. --

Begging your Excellency to Excuse
the liberty thus taken by a stranger but an ardent supporter and constituent

I have the honor to be
Most respectfully
A. B. Fontaine

His Excellency Govr Thos E. Bramlette
Frankfort Ky
Notary Public
Jefferson Co
F. Webber
apptd.
5th July/64
